name: childrens bedroom
description: A small room designated for the children of the household to sleep and play in.

name: corridor
description: A narrow passageway that connects different rooms or areas of the house.

name: hallway
description: A large entranceway that serves as the main thoroughfare of the house.

name: living room
description: A spacious room where the family can relax and socialize.

name: bathroom
description: A room equipped with basic amenities for personal hygiene and grooming.

name: bedroom
description: A private room designated for sleeping and personal space.

name: dining room
description: A formal room designated for family meals and special occasions.

name: kitchen
description: A room equipped for preparing and storing food.

name: outside
description: The outdoor areas surrounding the house, such as the garden or yard.

name: wc
description: A small room equipped with basic amenities for personal hygiene and grooming.

name: door
description: A movable barrier used to block off an entranceway to a room or building. Doors in rural Victorian England were often made of wood and featured ornate handles and hinges.

name: arch
description: A curved structure that spans an opening, often used as an architectural feature in rural Victorian English homes. Arches were typically made of brick or stone and were used to support the weight of walls or ceilings.

name: front door
description: The main entranceway to a rural Victorian English home, typically located at the front of the house. Front doors were often made of wood and featured elaborate designs and fittings.

name: drawing room
description: A formal living space often reserved for receiving and entertaining guests. In grander homes, it might have been separate from a regular living room.

name: morning room
description: A relaxed room, often adjacent to the dining room, where the family might gather in the morning. It sometimes had a feminine touch with lighter decor.

name: dressing room
description: Adjacent to bedrooms, this room was a space to store clothes, get dressed, and often had a vanity. More common in grander homes.

name: library
description: A room dedicated to the storage and reading of books. It might also serve as a study or office.

name: conservatory
description: A glass room, often attached to the side of a house, designed to house plants and offer a sunny space for relaxation.

name: pantry
description: A small storage room where food, dishes, and other household items are kept. It's typically close to the kitchen.

name: staircase
description: A set of steps connecting different floors of a house. Staircases in Victorian homes could be grand and ornate in wealthier homes, or simple and functional in more modest homes.
